intro: Dichapetalum fructuosum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, with erect stems and opposite leaves. Its flowers are bilaterally symmetrical, featuring five petals and a distinctive spur. It is widely cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
